title: WI-FI Router Installation
problem_statement:
WI-FI Router Installation

Problem Description

In a new smart city development, your task is to install Wi-Fi Routers with a fixed coverage radius to provide internet access to all residential buildings.

Every building can access the internet as long as it is within the router's coverage radius.

Given the positions of buildings A and routers B on a street, return the minimum coverage radius needed for the routers so that all buildings can be covered.

Notice that all the routers follow the same coverage standard, and the coverage radius will be the same.

Input Format:

First Argument is an Integer Array A, denoting the positions of buildings on the street.

Second Argument is an Integer Array B, denoting the routers on the street.

Output Format:

Return an integer denoting the minimum coverage radius needed for the routers so that all buildings can be covered.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: A = [5, 5, 7], B = [5]
Output: 2

Explanation: The only router was placed at position 5, and if we use a radius of 2, then all the buildings can access the internet.

Example 2:

Input: A = [1, 10], B = [3, 5, 7]
Output: 3

Explanation: The three routers were placed at positions 3, 5 and 7. We need to use a radius of 3 so that all the buildings can access the internet.

  • Building 1, can access the internet from router at position 3
  • Building 10 can access the internet from the router at position 7.

Note that, if we use radius of 2, then Building 10, cannot be able to access the internet!

Example 3:

Input: A = [1, 3, 2, 10], B = [1]
Output: 9

Explanation: The router was placed at position 1. We need to use a radius of 9 so that all the buildings can access the internet.

Constraints

  • 1 <= A.length, B.length <= 10^5
  • 1 <= A[i], B[i] <= 10^9

title: Star Removal
problem_statement:
Star Removal

Problem Description

You are given a string A. It may contain any number of '*' characters. Your task is to remove all '*' characters.

While there is a '*', do the following operation:

  • Delete the leftmost '*' and the smallest alphabet to its left. If there are several smallest characters, you can delete any of them.

Return the lexicographically smallest resulting string after removing all '*' characters.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: A = "aaba*"
Output: "aab"

Explanation: We should delete one of the 'a' characters with '*'. If we choose s[3], s becomes the lexicographically smallest.

Example 2:

Input: A = "abc"
Output: "abc"

Explanation: There is no '*' in the string.

Example 3:

Input: A = "aab*d*zd*"
Output: "dzd"

Explanation: In the first removal, removing the left most '*' at index 3. The smallest alphabet to its left(3) is "a". After the first removal "aab*d*zd*" becomes "abd*zd*" Now removing the left most '*' at index 3. The smallest alphabet to its left(3) is "a". After the second removal "abd*zd*" becomes "bdzd*" Now removing the left most '*' at index 4. The smallest alphabet to its left(4) is "b". After the third removal "bdzd*" becomes "dzd" Thus, the final string is "dzd"

Constraints

  • 1 <= A.length <= 105
  • A consists only of lowercase English letters and '*'
  • The input is generated such that it is possible to delete all '*' characters.

Input Format

The Only Argument is a String A

Output Format

Return the String. after performing the removal operation!

string Solution::clearStars(string A) {
    // Function body would go here
}

title: Not a Root of Polynomial
problem_statement:
Not a Root of Polynomial

Problem Description

Let P(x) = x³ - 6x² + 11x - 6. Which of the following is not a root of the polynomial?

Options

  • 4
  • 2
  • 1
  • 3

Matrix Square Calculation

Problem Description

Let A = 

[[2, 1],
 [0, 3]]
. What is A² (i.e., A × A)?

Options

  • A. 
    [[4, 5],
 [0, 9]]
  • B. 
    [[4, 2],
 [0, 9]]
  • C. 
    [[4, 1],
 [0, 6]]
  • D. 
    [[4, 3],
 [0, 6]]

Solve Inequality

Problem Description

Solve the inequality:

x-2 / x+3 > 1

Options

  • x < -3 or x > 5
  • x < -3
  • x > -3 and x < 5
  • x > -3 and x < 5

Evaluate Definite Integral

Problem Description

Evaluate: ∫₀¹ (3x² + 2x) dx

Options

  • 7/6
  • 2
  • 3/2
  • 5/3

Point of Inflection

Problem Description

Given f(x) = x³ - 6x² + 12x, determine the x-coordinate(s) of any point of inflection.

Options

  • x = 3
  • x = 1
  • x = 0
  • x = 2

Machine Learning Metric for Fraud Detection

Problem Description

You are building a real-time fraud detection system where false negatives are very costly (i.e., missing a fraud is worse than wrongly flagging a transaction). Which model evaluation metric should you prioritize?

Options

  • Recall
  • F1-Score
  • Precision
  • Accuracy

Machine Learning Model Performance Degradation

Problem Description

Your model, trained on last year's customer data, starts performing poorly on recent transactions. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

Options

  • Data drift
  • Over-regularization
  • Low variance
  • Underfitting

Conditional Probability - Balls in a Box

Problem Description

A box contains 4 red balls and 6 green balls. Two balls are drawn one after another without replacement. What is the probability that the second ball is red, given that the first ball was green?

Options

  • 4/9
  • 4/10
  • 3/9
  • 6/10

Expected Value of Discrete Random Variable

Problem Description

Let X be a discrete random variable with the following probability distribution:

  • P(X = 1) = 0.2
  • P(X = 2) = 0.5
  • P(X = 3) = 0.3

What is the expected value of X?

Options

  • 2.3
  • 2.1
  • 2.0
  • 1.9

Probability of Disease Given Positive Test

Problem Description

A test for a disease gives a false positive 5% of the time. The disease prevalence is 1%. If a person tests positive, what is the probability they actually have the disease? (Assume perfect sensitivity).

Options

  • 0.16
  • 0.50
  • 0.95
  • 0.10

Conditional Probability - Defective Item Source

Problem Description

A factory has two machines:

  • Machine A produces 60% of the total items and has a defect rate of 2%.
  • Machine B produces 40% of the total items and has a defect rate of 5%.

If an item is found to be defective, what is the probability that it was produced by Machine A?

Options

  • 3/11
  • 3/10
  • 6/19
  • 3/8

Chi-square Goodness of Fit Test Degrees of Freedom

Problem Description

In a chi-square goodness of fit test, the degrees of freedom is calculated as:

Options

  • k - 1
  • n - k
  • n - 1
  • n

Approximate Standard Deviation of Frequency Distribution

Problem Description

For the following frequency distribution:

| Class Interval | Frequency |
| -------------- | --------- |
| 0-10           | 2         |
| 10-20          | 4         |
| 20-30          | 6         |
| 30-40          | 8         |

What is the approximate standard deviation?

Options

  • 8.50
  • 15.00
  • 12.25
  • 10.00

Chi-square Test Statistic Property

Problem Description

In a Chi-square test, the test statistic is always:

Options

  • Positive
  • Negative
  • Normally distributed
  • Between 0 and 1

Machine Learning Metric for Imbalanced Dataset

Problem Description

Which of the following metrics is most appropriate for evaluating a binary classification model on a highly imbalanced dataset?

Options

  • Accuracy
  • F1 Score
  • Precision
  • Recall

Handling High-Cardinality Categorical Features

Problem Description

Which of the following techniques can be used for handling high-cardinality categorical features?

Options

  • One-hot encoding
  • PCA
  • Bag-of-words
  • Binary encoding
